verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: When King Hezekiah heard the report, he tore his clothes in grief, put on rough sackcloth, and went to the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests covered with sackcloth, unto Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.
verses.ct: He sent Eliakim, the palace administrator, along with Shebna the secretary and the senior priests, all wearing sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.
verses.ct: They told him, "This is what Hezekiah says: Today is a day of distress, punishment, and disgrace. We are like a woman ready to deliver but too weak to push the baby out."

verses.kjv: It may be the LORD thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God, and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is left.
verses.ct: "Perhaps the LORD your God has heard the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria sent to insult the living God, and will punish him for what the LORD your God has heard. So please pray for the survivors who remain."

verses.kjv: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
verses.ct: When King Hezekiah's officials arrived, Isaiah spoke to them.

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your master, Thus saith the LORD, Be not afraid of the words that thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
verses.ct: Isaiah told them, "Give your master this message. The LORD says: Don't be frightened by the words you heard — the insults that the Assyrian king's officers directed at me."

verses.kjv: Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am going to put a spirit in him so that when he hears a certain report, he will return to his own country. And I will have him killed by the sword in his own land."

verses.kjv: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
verses.ct: The Rabshakeh went back and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, because he had learned that the king had moved on from Lachish.

verses.kjv: And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, He is come forth to make war with thee. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then Sennacherib received a report that King Tirhakah of Ethiopia was marching out to fight against him. When he heard this, he sent messengers to Hezekiah with this message:

verses.kjv: Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God, in whom thou trustest, deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: "Tell Hezekiah king of Judah this: Don't let your God, the one you're trusting in, fool you by promising that Jerusalem won't be handed over to the king of Assyria."

verses.kjv: Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by destroying them utterly; and shalt thou be delivered?
verses.ct: "You've certainly heard what the kings of Assyria have done to every other nation — completely destroying them. Do you really think you'll be rescued?"

verses.kjv: Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed, as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Telassar?
verses.ct: "Did the gods of those nations save them? My predecessors destroyed Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden who lived in Telassar."

verses.kjv: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arphad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?
verses.ct: "Where is the king of Hamath now? Or the king of Arphad? Or the king of the city of Sepharvaim, or of Hena, or of Ivah?"

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up unto the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD.
verses.ct: Hezekiah took the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the house of the LORD and spread it out in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah prayed unto the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: Hezekiah prayed to the LORD, saying:

verses.kjv: O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, that dwellest between the cherubims, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth: thou hast made heaven and earth.
verses.ct: "LORD of hosts, God of Israel, enthroned above the cherubim — you alone are God over every kingdom on earth. You made heaven and earth."

verses.kjv: Incline thine ear, O LORD, and hear; open thine eyes, O LORD, and see: and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent to reproach the living God.
verses.ct: "Listen closely, LORD, and hear. Open your eyes, LORD, and see. Hear every word that Sennacherib has sent to insult the living God."

verses.kjv: Of a truth, LORD, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations, and their countries,
verses.ct: "It's true, LORD — the kings of Assyria have devastated all the nations and their lands."

verses.kjv: And have cast their gods into the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men’s hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.
verses.ct: "They threw those nations' gods into the fire. But those weren't really gods at all — just wood and stone shaped by human hands. That's why they could destroy them."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, O LORD our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the LORD, even thou only.
verses.ct: "So now, LORD our God, rescue us from his power, so that every kingdom on earth will know that you alone are the LORD."

verses.kjv: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Whereas thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria:
verses.ct: Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah: "The LORD, the God of Israel, says this: Because you prayed to me about Sennacherib king of Assyria,

verses.kjv: This is the word which the LORD hath spoken concerning him; The virgin, the daughter of Zion, hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.
verses.ct: this is what the LORD has declared about him: The young woman Zion despises you and mocks you. The daughter of Jerusalem shakes her head as you retreat.

verses.kjv: Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: Who is it you have insulted and cursed? Against whom have you raised your voice and looked with arrogance? Against the Holy One of Israel!

verses.kjv: By thy servants hast thou reproached the Lord, and hast said, By the multitude of my chariots am I come up to the height of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon; and I will cut down the tall cedars thereof, and the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the height of his border, and the forest of his Carmel.
verses.ct: Through your servants you have mocked the Lord. You boasted, 'With my massive army of chariots I have climbed the highest mountains, the remotest peaks of Lebanon. I have cut down its tallest cedars and finest cypress trees. I have reached its farthest heights and its densest forests.'

verses.kjv: I have digged, and drunk water; and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of the besieged places.
verses.ct: 'I have dug wells and drunk foreign water. With the soles of my feet I have dried up all the rivers of Egypt.'

verses.kjv: Hast thou not heard long ago, how I have done it; and of ancient times, that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste defenced cities into ruinous heaps.
verses.ct: Haven't you heard? I planned this long ago. In ancient times I designed it, and now I have brought it about — that you would crush fortified cities into piles of rubble.

verses.kjv: Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded: they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the housetops, and as corn blasted before it be grown up.
verses.ct: Their people had no strength left; they were terrified and humiliated. They were like grass in a field, like tender green plants, like grass sprouting on a rooftop — scorched before it can even grow.

verses.kjv: But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.
verses.ct: But I know everything about you — where you live, when you go out, when you come in, and how you rage against me.

verses.kjv: Because thy rage against me, and thy tumult, is come up into mine ears, therefore will I put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.
verses.ct: Because your fury against me and your arrogance have reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will force you back the same way you came."

verses.kjv: And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such as groweth of itself; and the second year that which springeth of the same: and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruit thereof.
verses.ct: "And this will be the sign for you, Hezekiah: This year you will eat what grows on its own. The second year you will eat what springs up from that. But in the 3rd year, plant and harvest, establish vineyards, and eat their produce."

verses.kjv: And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward:
verses.ct: "The survivors remaining from the house of Judah will once again put down roots and produce fruit."

verses.kjv: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the LORD of hosts shall do this.
verses.ct: "Because a remnant will come out of Jerusalem, and survivors will come from Mount Zion. The passionate commitment of the LORD of hosts will accomplish this."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shields, nor cast a bank against it.
verses.ct: "So this is what the LORD declares about the king of Assyria: He will not enter this city. He will not shoot a single arrow here. He will not advance against it with shields or build a siege ramp against it."

verses.kjv: By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "He will go back the same way he came, and he will not enter this city," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: For I will defend this city to save it for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.
verses.ct: "I will protect this city and save it, for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David."

verses.kjv: Then the angel of the LORD went forth, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.
verses.ct: Then the angel of the LORD went out and struck down 185,000 soldiers in the Assyrian camp. When the survivors got up early the next morning, they found dead bodies everywhere.

verses.kjv: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.
verses.ct: So King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp, withdrew, and went back to live in Nineveh.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Armenia: and Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: One day, while he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer killed him with swords. They then escaped to the land of Armenia, and his son Esarhaddon became king in his place.
